Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; exterior: rim glazed; in handle zone black-figure komos scene: from left, bearded male to right (head with added red on hair remaining), bent over female (back and part of head remaining); to right, youth (or female? - head, arms, and upper body remaining), to right, looking back and gesticulating.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venite talks of a symplegma of man and youth, but such scenes normally involve a female, not male partner. For a list of such scenes on little-master cups see Heesen 2011, 107, n.639.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 89, no. 301, pl. 66)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 402, B598, pl. CXCIX)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1390) (phase 3)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (pl. 7)
